channel.title: Sharing a folder on your local network but password protecting it
channel.description: can windows 7 do this and how, I've been looking everywhere....

item.title: Sharing a folder on your local network but password protecting it
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Frell:

If I have to ill use dropbox but id much prefer to edit/load them in realtime and not have to wait on any syncing

I use it to sync images and psd from my Mac to my work PC (work PC doesn’t have photoshop etc) when I’m web developing, it’s really all pretty seamless, the time it takes for me to move my hands from each keyboard and navigate to the file it’s already there

Read full topic
item.source: Sharing a folder on your local network but password protecting it

item.title: Sharing a folder on your local network but password protecting it
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:6, topic:483200”]Ah, one is windows 7 and one is windows 8

that explains a bit, still compatible? Ive never been prompted for a password[/quote]

It’s still compatible. I’ve connected to my Windows 7 desktop from Windows XP.

Read full topic

item.title: Sharing a folder on your local network but password protecting it
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Just use dropbox, I use it across 5 different machines all running different operating systems, for the main bulk of files (videos, music etc) I have an NAS though, could look into that.

item.title: Sharing a folder on your local network but password protecting it
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:4, topic:483200”]vortex does that work cross computer?

I’m trying to make my laptop be able to access files on my desktop but not have them accessible by anyone on the same wifi as me[/quote]

sure create the account then when you access the folder on the network it should prompt you with a open with “user” atleast that works with XP I would assume its still available.

Read full topic

item.source: Sharing a folder on your local network but password protecting it

item.title: Sharing a folder on your local network but password protecting it
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:4, topic:483200”]vortex does that work cross computer?

I’m trying to make my laptop be able to access files on my desktop but not have them accessible by anyone on the same wifi as me[/quote]

Assuming both pc’s are using the same os frell. Then you should just be able to connect from laptop to pc and you should be prompted for a password. Enter the password for the account that has the rights and it should let you in and keep all other accounts out.

Read full topic

item.title: Sharing a folder on your local network but password protecting it
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

One way would be to create a new account, give it a password and through advanced sharing settings for the folder deny everyone but that user from accessing the folder:
